result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T Mattson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Gratification w/ Animal Sex Organ, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.17(2)(d).
  • Sexual Gratification w/ Animal Sex Organ, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.17(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Justin Griffis advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Filed by Atty. Griffis.

9:07 AM This case is called for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant Jordan T Mattson appeared by zoom video, in custody from John C. Burke Correctional.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Jordan T Mattson.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed today.  Atty Griffis outlines the offer, State confirms. Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Court has concerns about how this matter was charged.  Atty Griffis presents statements and moves to have case dismissed.  State responds. They are willing to file an amended complaint to correct the error. Atty Griffis would not object to the amendment and would be willing to proceed to plea and sentencing today if possible. State moves to amend Count 1 and Count 2 to Wis. Stat. 944.17(2)(d).  Atty Griffis has no objection to the amendment. Court has colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds defendant has no objection to the amendment. Court orders Counts 1 & 2 be amended to Wis. Stat. 944.17(2)(d). Court continues with the plea colloquy. Defendant enters a guilty plea to amended Counts 1 & 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing arguments made by the State
Sentencing arguments made by Atty Griffis
Defendant presents statement

COUNT 1:

The Court Orders the Following:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS (Concurrent to Count 2, but Consecutive to any other current sentence).  Sentence commences immediately.

COSTS: Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be converted to a civil judgment.


COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS (Concurrent to Count 1, but Consecutive to any other current sentence).  Sentence commences immediately.

COSTS: Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be converted to a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:22 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Jordan T Mattson appeared by phone, in custody at John C Burke Correctional.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Jordan T Mattson.  Court notes the defendant was supposed to appear by Zoom video but the facility was having technical issues this morning so video is not available.  Court will require either an in person or video appearance to proceed with plea and sentencing so the matter will have to be rescheduled.  State and Defense have no objection.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to appear by video from John C Burke Correctional for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Character letter filed by defendant's father.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:12 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jordan T Mattson in court by Zoom video means, in custody at John C Burke Correctional, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Court inquires how the defendant will appear for the next court date.  Atty. Griffis advises his client would like to appear by Zoom video.  Court confirms with the defendant he would like to appear by video.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from John C Burke Correctional for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for August 1, 2022.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jordan T Mattson in court by telephone, in custody at John C Burke Correctional, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Giffis provides an update, he received some additional discovery but still has some outstanding discovery he needs to receive.  Atty. Griffis requests another further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings. Defendant to appear by video from John S. Burke Correctional for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received via fax from John Burke Correctional
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with a pet.

10:34 AM Defendant Jordan T Mattson appeared by Zoom, in custody, from John Burke Correctional with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant to appear by Zoom from John Burke Correctional at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
